Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Homelessne.Homelessness_with_annotation: Throughout Shizuoka Prefecture, 8 buildings were destroyed and a further 1,439 buildings were damaged by flooding.

Total_Summary_Injury.Total_Injury_Annotation: It was also reported that 10 people were injured and nearly 10,000 houses were without power.

Total_Injury_Per_Country.Injury_with_annotation: It was also reported that 10 people were injured and nearly 10,000 houses were without power.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Injury.Injury_with_annotation: At the Kadena Air Base, the typhoon killed a U.S. airman and left two others missing after they were swept out to sea.
It was also reported that 10 people were injured and nearly 10,000 houses were without power.

Main_Event_Assessment_With_Annotation: Typhoon Phanfone, known in the Philippines as Typhoon Neneng, was a powerful tropical cyclone which affected Japan in early October 2014.

Total_Summary_Death.Total_Death_Annotation: In Japan, a total of eleven people were killed by the typhoon, with several others missing or injured.

Total_Death_Per_Country.Death_with_annotation: In Japan, a total of eleven people were killed by the typhoon, with several others missing or injured.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Death.Death_with_annotation: At the Kadena Air Base, the typhoon killed a U.S. airman and left two others missing after they were swept out to sea.
In Japan, a total of eleven people were killed by the typhoon, with several others missing or injured.

Total_Summary_Insured_Damage.Total_Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_ann: Total economic losses nationwide were estimated at ¥10.5 billion (US$100 million) by Aon Benfield.

Total_Insured_Damage_Per_Country.Total_Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_ann: Total economic losses nationwide were estimated at ¥10.5 billion (US$100 million) by Aon Benfield.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Insured_Da.Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_annotatio: Throughout Shizuoka Prefecture, 8 buildings were destroyed and a further 1,439 buildings were damaged by flooding. Losses in the prefecture amounted to ¥3.21 billion (US$29.5 million).
Agricultural damage in Japan was calculated at ¥7.7 billion (US$70.7 million).

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Displaceme.Displacement_with_annotation: Six public shelters were opened at schools across Saipan; however, no one utilized them.

Location_with_Annotation.Mariana Islands: On September 29, the National Weather Service office in Guam issued a tropical storm watch for Saipan, Tinian, and the Northern Mariana Islands in anticipation of Phanfone's arrival the following day.
Location_with_Annotation.Japan: Phanfone started affecting Japan late on October 4, as it began weakening. High waves and winds of 90 mph (150 km/h) were reported most in southern Japan.
Location_with_Annotation.Alaska: The extratropical remnant of Phanfone brought locally strong winds to portions of the Alaskan Peninsula from October 12–13.
Location_with_Annotation.British Columbia, Canada: Moisture associated with Phanfone later fueled a separate cyclone over the Gulf of Alaska which brought heavy rains to parts of British Columbia, Canada.

Agricultural damage in Japan was calculated at ¥7.7 billion (US$70.7 million).

Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Wind: High waves and winds of 90 mph (150 km/h) were reported most in southern Japan.
Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Rainfall: Phanfone also affected the Formula One 2014 Japanese Grand Prix, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall which made the track surface wet and significantly reduced visibility.
